dublin_core: Fincher, Sally Dziallas, Sebastian Brandes, Ofra Kolikant, Yifat Ben-David Shapiro, R. Benjamin 2017-06-19T11:36:40Z 2017-06-19T11:36:40Z 2016-07 Fincher, S., Dziallas, S., Brandes, O., Kolikant, Y. B., & Shapiro, R. B. (2016). Negotiating Academic Communities: Narratives of Life-long Learners In Looi, C. K., Polman, J. L., Cress, U., and Reimann, P. (Eds.). Transforming Learning, Empowering Learners: The International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2016, Volume 2. Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences, pp. 35-43. https://doi.dx.org/10.22318/icls2016.166 We bring together three case studies in computer science and engineering which were launched for the same purpose: to understand what participants – students, high-school teachers, and university teachers – considered themselves to be significant in their pursuit of professional growth and what empowered and disempowered them. All three studies use narrative methods, although in different ways. The studies share two findings: (a) participants were engaged in processes of becoming or being life-long learners, and (b) the importance of community in their narratives. en Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences Negotiating Academic Communities: Narratives of Life-long Learners Book chapter <dc:subject xml:lang="en">computer science</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">narrative methods</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">community</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">life-long learning</dc:subject>
